reporter_caption.center: EGGERS v. NORWOOD INDUSTRIAL LOAN CO., 61 Ohio App. 56 (1938)

caption.center: EGGERS, APPELLEE v. THE NORWOOD INDUSTRIAL LOAN CO., APPELLANT.

opinion.syllabus:
Evidence — Plaintiff's attorney a witness — Defendant's right to cross-examine as to interest in case.
It is error for the trial court, when plaintiff's attorney is on the stand testifying in plaintiff's behalf, to refuse defendant the right to cross-examine the attorney regarding his interest in the case by way of a contingent fee, if such is the basis of his employment, for such matter is a proper subject of cross-examination as bearing upon his credibility.
opinion.posture: APPEAL: Court of Appeals for Hamilton county.
opinion.attorneys:
Mr. Lawrence B. Schwartz, for appellee.
Mr. Robert A. Black and Mr. John Bolsinger, for appellant.
opinion.opinion_text:
Two points of error are stressed in this appeal: First, that the court erred in refusing defendant the right to cross-examine plaintiff's attorney regarding his interest in the case. The court erred in so doing. The attorney was on the stand giving evidence in favor of plaintiff. His interest in the case by way of a contingent fee, if such was the basis of his employment, was a proper subject for cross-examination as bearing upon his credibility.
Second, the court is further of the opinion that the verdict and judgment are manifestly against the weight of the evidence. We will not comment on the evidence as the case will have to be retried.
The judgment is reversed and the case remanded for a new trial and further proceedings according to law.
Judgment reversed.
ROSS, P.J., HAMILTON and MATTHEWS, JJ., concur.Page 57
